lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarand Ras Loubhit Hui , Sahaj Samaadhi Soukh Sanpat Samaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming a true servant of Satguru Ji, remaining fond of the fragrance of the dust of the holy feet of the True Guru, and in perpetual contemplation, a Sikh permeates himself in the spiritual peace.

lines.transliteration_english: Bhaijal Bhaiaanak Lahari N Biaapi Sakai , Doubidhaa Nivaari Ayk Tayk Tthaharaanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-conscious person is never affected by the frightening worldly waves of desires and hopes. He is deemed to have destroyed all duality and taken the refuge of the Lord.

lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Sabad Surati Baraji Bisarajata , Praym Naym Bisam Bisvaas Ur Aanay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He keeps his eyes away from the evils and ears closed to the slander and praise. Ever engrossed in Naam Simran, he imbibes the celestial faith of the Lord in his mind.

lines.transliteration_english: Jeevan Moukati Jagajeevan Jeevan Moola , Aapaa Khoi Hoi Aparanpar Paraanai Hai ?92?

Shabad OS B.translation: Liberated Guru-conscious Sikh sheds all his ego and becomes a devotee of the infinite Lord, the creator of the World and source of all life on it. (92)
